task_name: teach my parent to use video calls
task_description: Task to teach my parent to use video calls

nice_to_have: Show them how to invite others to a call
Encourage them to practice with family members first
Introduce them to screen sharing for tutorials
deal_breakers: Insists on using outdated devices that are not compatible with video call apps
Expresses frustration with learning new things

decision_factors: Availability of devices with video call capability
Need for regular communication with family
Potential frustration with learning new technology
Access to support resources for troubleshooting

technical: Something modern that works well with video calls
I think I need a good camera but I'm not sure what makes it good
A fast internet connection, I heard that matters but not sure how fast
non_technical: Patience during the learning process, but I hope it won't take too long
Some kind of friendly guidance, like a buddy system or something
Unknown/Not sure how to make it fun for them to learn

must_meet: They should be able to join a video call, but I'm not clear on how to check if they can
I think they need to understand how to mute and unmute, but not sure why that's important
should_meet: They might need to feel comfortable with the interface, but I'm not confident in what that looks like
I heard practicing with someone helps, but I can't say for sure
nice_to_meet: If they can send invites to others, that would be nice but not essential
They could learn about screen sharing, but I don't know how necessary that is

metadata.task: teach my parent to use video calls
